content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Here is an implementation in Julia:

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    # Regular expression to match the code fences and capture the inner content
    p = r"(?s)(?<=\n)```julia(.*?)\n```\n"
    matches = collect(eachmatch(p, md))  # Find all matches in the markdown document
    
    if isempty(matches)
        return ""  # Return an empty string if no code blocks found
    end
    
    # Concatenate the code blocks
    joined_code = reduce((x, y) -> x * "\n" * y, matches);
    return joined_code;
end
```

This function works by using a regular expression to find all the Julia language code blocks in the markdown document. It then concatenates these blocks together with newline characters between each block. If no code blocks are found it returns an empty string.

Please note that this function assumes that the input `md` is a valid Markdown document and there's at least one piece of Julia language code in it.
